1.text: Now as touching things offered unto idols, we know that we all have knowledge. Knowledge puffeth up, but charity edifieth.

2.text: And if any man think that he knoweth any thing, he knoweth nothing yet as he ought to know.

3.text: But if any man love God, the same is known of him.

4.text: As concerning therefore the eating of those things that are offered in sacrifice unto idols, we know that an idol [is] nothing in the world, and that [there is] none other God but one.

5.text: For though there be that are called gods, whether in heaven or in earth, (as there be gods many, and lords many,)

6.text: But to us [there is but] one God, the Father, of whom [are] all things, and we in him; and one Lord Jesus Christ, by whom [are] all things, and we by him.

7.text: Howbeit [there is] not in every man that knowledge: for some with conscience of the idol unto this hour eat [it] as a thing offered unto an idol; and their conscience being weak is defiled.

8.text: But meat commendeth us not to God: for neither, if we eat, are we the better; neither, if we eat not, are we the worse.

9.text: But take heed lest by any means this liberty of yours become a stumblingblock to them that are weak.

10.text: For if any man see thee which hast knowledge sit at meat in the idolâ€™s temple, shall not the conscience of him which is weak be emboldened to eat those things which are offered to idols;

11.text: And through thy knowledge shall the weak brother perish, for whom Christ died?

12.text: But when ye sin so against the brethren, and wound their weak conscience, ye sin against Christ.

13.text: Wherefore, if meat make my brother to offend, I will eat no flesh while the world standeth, lest I make my brother to offend.
